description: Can I give my baby honey?
title: Confused about breastfeeding
content:
My baby was born at the hospital and the doctor and the nurse told me that I must only give her breastmilk – nothing else. Now that I am at home, I feel so confused. My mother-in-law has told me to give honey to my baby every morning. She says it will improve her immunity and make her more resistant to disease. I asked my husband and he says that that I should follow his mother’s advice as she has more experience than me. But I remember the doctor said I must give her nothing but breastmilk until she is 6 months old. What should I do?

**MAMA Help:** Listen to your doctor. You should give your baby only breastmilk and no other food - not even water or honey. If you can do this until your baby is 6 months you can reduce the risk of infectious diseases like diarrhoea. These diseases can cause malnutrition and stunting.
